summary: Summit is a mature, enterprise-grade intelligence platform repository implementing a sophisticated monorepo architecture with 448+ packages, 200+ services, and 28+ applications. The repository demonstrates exceptional CI/CD maturity with 147 active GitHub Actions workflows, comprehensive security scanning (CodeQL, gitleaks, SBOM), and policy-as-code governance (OPA). Documentation is extensive (4,178 markdown files, 35MB) but may benefit from improved discoverability. Developer experience tooling is robust with deterministic bootstrap, DevContainers, and multi-agent provisioning. Key gaps exist in marketing evidence automation, test coverage visibility in CI, and documentation freshness validation. The platform is well-positioned for GA with strong foundations in reproducibility, security, and compliance evidence collection.

critical_issues.title: Test Coverage Not Enforced in Main CI Pipeline
critical_issues.description: While coverage thresholds are configured (80% in jest.config.cjs), the main ci.yml workflow does not explicitly gate on coverage metrics. Coverage collection happens but enforcement is not visible in PR gates.
critical_issues.impact: Code with insufficient test coverage may be merged, increasing technical debt and regression risk.
critical_issues.recommendation: Add explicit coverage gate step to ci.yml using coverage:gate script with failure on threshold violations.

critical_issues.title: Documentation Freshness and Link Validation Missing
critical_issues.description: With 4,178 markdown files across 519 directories, no automated validation exists for stale content, broken internal links, or outdated API references.
critical_issues.impact: Developer confusion, wasted time following outdated procedures, potential security risks from obsolete guidance.
critical_issues.recommendation: Implement docs-linkcheck and freshness-audit workflows with automated PR annotations.

critical_issues.title: Marketing Claims Not Automatically Validated Against Evidence
critical_issues.description: Marketing and pitch materials exist (Summit-IntelGraph_Pioneers_Deck.pptx, OnePager.pdf) but no automated pipeline validates claims against CI evidence bundles.
critical_issues.impact: Risk of marketing claims diverging from actual platform capabilities, compliance and trust issues.
critical_issues.recommendation: Implement claim-evidence-matrix workflow that cross-references docs/marketing claims with CI test results and capability attestations.

critical_issues.title: Inconsistent Version Pinning Across Tool Chains
critical_issues.description: .nvmrc specifies Node v20.19.0 but .tool-versions specifies nodejs 20.11.0. Multiple Python pyproject.toml files lack version pins for critical dependencies.
critical_issues.impact: Environment drift between developers, CI, and production causing hard-to-reproduce bugs.
critical_issues.recommendation: Consolidate version specifications and add version-drift-check workflow to CI.

critical_issues.title: 200+ Archived Workflows Create Maintenance Burden
critical_issues.description: .github/workflows/.archive/ contains 200+ legacy workflows that may cause confusion and slow repository operations.
critical_issues.impact: Slower git operations, potential for accidental resurrection of deprecated workflows, cognitive overhead.
critical_issues.recommendation: Migrate archived workflows to separate branch or git-lfs, document migration timeline, implement archive cleanup policy.

critical_issues.title: SBOM Generation Not Integrated Into Release Artifacts
critical_issues.description: sbom-scan.yml exists but SBOM attestation is not automatically attached to release artifacts or container images.
critical_issues.impact: Supply chain compliance gaps, difficulty responding to vulnerability inquiries from customers.
critical_issues.recommendation: Integrate SBOM generation into release-ga.yml with automatic artifact attachment and signing.

critical_issues.title: No Centralized Error/Troubleshooting Guide
critical_issues.description: Despite extensive runbooks (40+), no centralized FAQ or troubleshooting decision tree exists for common development issues.
critical_issues.impact: Developers waste time debugging common issues that could be quickly resolved with documented solutions.
critical_issues.recommendation: Create docs/troubleshooting/FAQ.md with searchable error codes and resolution paths.

critical_issues.title: Performance Regression Testing Not in Main CI Path
critical_issues.description: Performance testing workflows exist (perf.yml, ci-perf) but are not triggered on PR merges to main.
critical_issues.impact: Performance regressions may ship undetected, causing customer-facing latency issues.
critical_issues.recommendation: Add lightweight performance smoke test to ci.yml or implement scheduled nightly performance suite with regression alerts.

critical_issues.title: ADR Index Not Automatically Updated
critical_issues.description: docs/ADR/ADR_INDEX.md exists but new ADRs must be manually added to the index.
critical_issues.impact: ADR discoverability issues, potential for duplicate or conflicting architectural decisions.
critical_issues.recommendation: Implement adr-index-sync workflow that auto-generates index from ADR file metadata.

critical_issues.title: docs-site Underutilized Relative to /docs Volume
critical_issues.description: Docusaurus-based docs-site exists but only 20KB vs 35MB in /docs, suggesting public documentation site is not fully populated.
critical_issues.impact: External stakeholders may not have access to comprehensive documentation, reducing adoption.
critical_issues.recommendation: Implement docs-sync workflow to selectively publish public-safe documentation to docs-site.

ci_coverage_gate.description: Add to ci.yml to enforce coverage thresholds
ci_coverage_gate.yaml:
coverage-gate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [test]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: coverage-report
          path: coverage/
      - name: Check coverage thresholds
        run: |
          pnpm coverage:verify --branches 80 --functions 80 --lines 80 --statements 80
      - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v4
        with:
          files: coverage/lcov.info
          fail_ci_if_error: true

docs_linkcheck_workflow.yaml:
name: Documentation Health Check
on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 6 * * 1'  # Weekly Monday 6 AM
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  linkcheck:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Check markdown links
        uses: gaurav-nelson/github-action-markdown-link-check@v1
        with:
          folder-path: 'docs/'
          config-file: '.markdown-link-check.json'
      - name: Check for stale docs
        run: |
          find docs -name '*.md' -mtime +180 -type f > stale-docs.txt
          if [ -s stale-docs.txt ]; then
            echo '::warning::Found documentation not updated in 180+ days'
            cat stale-docs.txt
          fi
      - name: Upload stale docs report
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: docs-health-report
          path: stale-docs.txt

sbom_release_integration.description: SBOM generation and signing for release-ga.yml
sbom_release_integration.yaml:
sbom-generate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [build]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Generate CycloneDX SBOM
        run: |
          pnpm dlx @cyclonedx/cyclonedx-npm --output-file sbom.cyclonedx.json
      - name: Generate SPDX SBOM
        run: |
          pnpm dlx @cyclonedx/cyclonedx-npm --output-format spdx --output-file sbom.spdx.json
      - name: Sign SBOM with Cosign
        uses: sigstore/cosign-installer@v3
      - run: |
          cosign sign-blob --yes sbom.cyclonedx.json --output-signature sbom.cyclonedx.sig
      - name: Attach SBOM to release
        uses: softprops/action-gh-release@v1
        with:
          files: |
            sbom.cyclonedx.json
            sbom.cyclonedx.sig
            sbom.spdx.json

# Service health

services=("postgres:5434" "redis:6379" "neo4j:7474")
for svc in "${services[@]}"; do
  name=${svc%%:*}
  port=${svc##*:}
  if nc -z localhost $port 2>/dev/null; then
    echo "  ‚úÖ $name (port $port)"

    echo "  ‚ùå $name (port $port) - NOT RUNNING"

done
echo ''

# Git status

echo "  Uncommitted: $(git status --porcelain | wc -l) files"

echo '‚ú® Health check complete'
